channel.title: Monitoring Memcached on Run production-grade databases easily on Kubernetes
channel.description: Recent content in Monitoring Memcached on Run production-grade databases easily on Kubernetes

item.title: Monitor Memcached using Builtin Prometheus Discovery
item.description: New to KubeDB? Please start here. Monitoring Memcached with builtin Prometheus This tutorial will show you how to monitor Memcached server using builtin Prometheus scrapper. Before You Begin At first, you need to have a Kubernetes cluster, and the kubectl command-line tool must be configured to communicate with your cluster. If you do not already have a cluster, you can create one by using Minikube. Install KubeDB operator in your cluster following the steps here.

item.title: Monitor Memcached using Coreos Prometheus Operator
item.description: New to KubeDB? Please start here. Monitoring Memcached Using CoreOS Prometheus Operator CoreOS prometheus-operator provides simple and Kubernetes native way to deploy and configure Prometheus server. This tutorial will show you how to use CoreOS Prometheus operator to monitor Memcached server deployed with KubeDB. Before You Begin At first, you need to have a Kubernetes cluster, and the kubectl command-line tool must be configured to communicate with your cluster.
